text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Acorn Electron is an entry-level version of the BBC Micro with only 32 kB of RAM and the use of a 4-bit memory system instead of the BBC's 8, to keep costs down. A magazine then reported that games made for the BBC were running 'at less than half their speed'. And despite some publishers shunning the machine, a good range of games were available, including popular multi-format games such as Chuckie Egg. There were approximately 1,400 games released in 1990 and joystick support available through a cartridge from Power Software.
